author: Andy Restrepo
title: Key Bengals Position Coach Names 2 Massive Traits Players Need
text:
Key Bengals Position Coach Names 2 Massive Traits Players Need
The Cincinnati Bengals have recently appointed Scott Peters as their new offensive line coach. Peters, who comes from the New England Patriots where he served as the offensive line coach in 2024, brings a wealth of experience and a proven track record to the team. Before his time with the Patriots, he was the assistant offensive line coach for the Cleveland Browns from 2020-2023. In a recent interview with Dan Howard on the team's radio podcast, Peters emphasized two critical traits that he believes are essential for players: mental toughness and pass protection technique. When asked about the importance of...
Read more at athlonsports.com

author: Cheri Irwin
title: Which country has smart city?
text:
Which country has smart city?
Singapore has been elected as the smartest city in the world, followed by Helsinki. Zurich, Auckland, Oslo, Copenhagen, Geneva, and Taipei City also made it to the list of top smart cities.
What is the most digitalized city in the world?
According to reports, Singapore is considered the most digitalized city in the world. The implementation of several smart city initiatives in various sectors of life has positioned Singapore as the city of the future.
Which is the No 1 most global smart city?
Zurich, Switzerland has been ranked as the number 1 most global smart city, followed by Oslo and Canberra. Copenhagen, Lausanne, London, Singapore, Helsinki, Geneva, Stockholm, Hamburg, Beijing, Abu Dhabi, Prague, and Amsterdam also made it to the top 15 list.
Which is the smartest city in the world?
Based on the list of top smart cities, Singapore has been elected as the smartest city in the world. Helsinki, Zurich, Auckland, Oslo, Copenhagen, Geneva, and Taipei City also made it to the top 10 list.
Is Chicago a smart city?
Yes, Chicago in the United States is considered a smart city. The city has implemented various smart city initiatives, such as the Array of Things initiative, which aims to collect data and improve the quality of life for its residents.
What are the problems with smart cities?
Some challenges in implementing smart cities include high initial investment costs, lack of interoperability and standardization of technologies, data privacy and security concerns, resistance to change from citizens and government officials, and inadequate digital infrastructure in some areas.
Are smart cities a good idea?
Smart cities have the potential to transform the work environment, streamline processes, and improve the quality of life for citizens by using smart technologies and data analysis. They offer numerous benefits such as increased efficiency, improved services, and economic growth. However, there are also challenges and risks associated with smart cities that need to be addressed.
What city has the most geniuses?
According to studies, Ann Arbor in Michigan, United States has been ranked as the city with the highest average IQ, making it a city with a high concentration of geniuses. San Jose, Washington, DC, San Francisco, Madison, Durham, Boston, and Raleigh also made it to the list of cities with high intellectual capacity.
What city has the most smartest people?
The smartest states in the United States are Massachusetts, New Hampshire, North Dakota, Vermont, Minnesota, Maine, Montana, Iowa, Connecticut, and Wisconsin. Massachusetts has the highest average IQ, making it the state with the most smartest people.
What is a smart city?
A smart city is a municipality that uses information and communication technologies (ICT) to increase operational efficiency, share information with the public, and improve both the quality of government services and citizen welfare.
Where do the smartest people live?
The smartest cities in the United States based on educational attainment and intellectual capacity are Ann Arbor, San Jose, Washington, DC, San Francisco, Madison, Durham, Boston, Raleigh, and others.
What is the risk in smart cities?
Smart cities collect large amounts of data on individuals through various technologies. The risk lies in potential data privacy breaches and misuse of personal information. Improperly secured devices can be vulnerable to cyberattacks, leading to fraudulent transactions and identity theft.
What is the point of a smart city?
The main goal of a smart city is to optimize city functions, promote economic growth, and improve the quality of life for citizens through the use of smart technologies and data analysis.
Does China have smart cities?
China has been actively developing smart cities, with cities like Beijing and Shanghai leading the way in smart city initiatives. The application of modern technology in urban life is being used to achieve the goals of smart cities.
What are the advantages of smart cities?
Smart cities offer several advantages, including increased efficiency, improved services, economic growth, and a better quality of life for citizens. They use technology and data analysis to optimize city processes and enhance governmental functions.
What city is at the heart of smart city advancements?
Singapore is considered the city at the heart of smart city advancements. The implementation of various smart city initiatives in Singapore has positioned it as a city of the future.
How many smart cities are there in the world?
While there is no unanimous definition of a smart city, it is believed that there are currently over 140 smart cities worldwide. This number is rapidly expanding as more cities embrace smart technologies and initiatives.
Where are the smartest cities in the US?
The smartest cities in the United States are Ann Arbor, San Jose, Washington, DC, San Francisco, Madison, Durham, Boston, Raleigh, and others.
Where will smart cities be built?
Numerous smart city projects are expected to be built in the near future. Some of these projects include The Line in Saudi Arabia, Telosa in the United States, BiodiverCity Penang in Malaysia, Maldives Floating City in the Maldives, Akon City in Senegal, Net City and Chengdu Future City in China, and The Orbit in Innisfil, Canada.
Who started smart cities?
Cisco launched the global “Intelligent Urbanization” initiative to help cities use the network as the fourth utility for integrated city management, better quality of life, and economic development. Their efforts have contributed to the development of smart cities worldwide.
Why are smart cities being built?
Smart cities are being built to optimize city functions, promote economic growth, and improve the quality of life for citizens. The use of smart technologies and data analysis allows cities to become more efficient, sustainable, and responsive to the needs of their residents.
Is New York a smart city?
Yes, New York City in the United States is considered a smart city. The city has embraced various smart city initiatives to improve services, increase efficiency, and enhance the quality of life for its residents.
What city has the most smartest people?
Ann Arbor in Michigan, United States, has been ranked as the city with the highest average IQ, making it a city with a high concentration of smart people. San Jose, Washington, DC, San Francisco, Madison, Durham, Boston, and Raleigh also have a high intellectual capacity.
Where are 15-minute cities in the US?
The concept of 15-minute cities is being embraced by cities such as Ann Arbor, Michigan, and Cleveland. Portland, Eugene, and other cities in Oregon are also implementing their own versions of the concept. The idea has inspired both support and pushback in different regions.
Is Mexico a smart city?
Mexico City, also known as Distrito Federal (DF), has been recognized as one of the smartest cities in Latin America by Fast Company Magazine. It ranked 101 among 135 smart cities in the world according to the “Cities in Motion Index 2014” by the University of Navarra.
What is the disadvantage of a smart city?
Living in a smart city has some disadvantages. Some concerns include data privacy issues, unequal access to technology, and the need for collaboration across private, public, and government sectors. Additionally, there are risks and dangers associated with smart cities that can outweigh the benefits.

author: CNN Newsource
title: Questions mount over six hostages’ fate in Gaza after IDF finds gunshot wounds
text:
By Tara John, Nadeen Ebrahim and Mike Schwartz, CNN
Tel Aviv (CNN) — Fury was palpable at the end of a demonstration in Tel Aviv on Thursday, as protesters demanded a deal to free Israeli hostages in Gaza and grieved this week’s news that the bodies of six captives had been retrieved.
Their tragic fate has raised fears that more Israeli hostages will not be retrieved alive either, said one protester. “We need to bring back those that we know were alive,” Daniel told CNN. Continuing war as negotiations for a ceasefire-hostage deal falter “will only bring more coffins to them and to us,” the 48-year-old added.
There has been no official explanation yet of how the six died.
On Thursday, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said that initial forensic tests suggest that all six hostages had been shot, but it has not determined whether the gunshot wounds were the cause of death. IDF also underlined that the findings are preliminary.
The IDF said four additional bodies were found next to the bodies of the six hostages, which were believed to be those of the Hamas militants who had been holding the hostages, but that no evidence of shooting was found on their bodies.
The IDF did not name any alleged shooter.
But standing outside Israel’s Ministry of Defense, Daniel said the IDF’s announcement that all six hostages had been shot underlines the potential danger in rescue operations that depend on force.
Israeli outlet Ynet had reported on Tuesday that an IDF preliminary assessment was that the hostages may have died due to suffocation after the IDF hit a nearby Hamas target and carbon dioxide flooded the tunnel where they were being held.
Asked in a news conference on Tuesday whether the IDF had killed the hostages, spokesperson Rear Adm. Daniel Hagari did not clarify whether the hostages had been killed as a result of Israeli military action. Instead, Hagari referred back to a statement he made in June, when he had said the “the hostages were killed while our forces were operating in Khan Younis.”
Urgency and chaos
The deaths have renewed urgency for a ceasefire among the protesters in Tel Aviv on Thursday.
Omer, 46, who was at the protest with his two daughters, said that he believed the six hostages “could have been saved a lot earlier.” He accused the Israeli government of repeatedly stalling on inking a deal with Hamas, which he warned would only led to Israel paying a higher price for an agreement that could have been secured earlier.
A ceasefire would also bring relief to hundreds of thousands of Palestinians living in the besieged enclave as Israel forges ahead with its military operation. The United Nations estimated in July that up to 1.9 million people in the strip have been displaced, almost the entire population of Gaza.
Amid renewed Israeli evacuation orders, the IDF-designated “humanitarian zone” in the Strip has been steadily shrinking. In the past month alone, the IDF has reduced this zone by 38% – with the remaining space making up just over a tenth of Gaza’s total area, according to a CNN analysis.
At least 22 Palestinians were killed in southern Gaza on Thursday, among them a child and four women, Dr. Mohammad Saqer told CNN from Nasser Hospital. An Israeli airstrike on a house in Bani Suhaila, east of Khan Younis, resulted in the killing of at least five members of a single family, whose bodies were taken to the hospital, according to a family member.
The family had tried to follow the IDF’s orders, according to Hamza Abu Shab, a relative of the victims. But an airstrike hit before they reached an evacuation zone, killing several family members, including his father.
There is skepticism within Israel about Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s willingness to strike a deal in Gaza given fierce opposition from far-right ministers in his coalition. The Israeli prime minister’s political future largely depends on his far right coalition partners – several of whom have already threatened to leave the government and cause its collapse if he agrees to the deal.
“Maybe Hamas kidnapped them (the hostages), but the one we can accuse of murdering them is Benjamin Netanyahu,” protester Omer said, adding that the prime minister is “the only one responsible.”
A group representing the families of Israeli hostages, the Hostages and Missing Families Forum, said in a Thursday statement that the forensic tests that found gunshot wounds amounted to “further proof of the cruelty of the terrorists” who held them in captivity.
The Forum also reiterated criticism of Israeli authorities, saying that the recovery of bodies “is no achievement.”
“It is a testimony of the complete failure to reach a deal in time, as six hostages who were supposed to return alive have returned in coffins,” the Forum said.
The recovered bodies were identified by Israeli officials on Tuesday as belonging to Yoram Metzger, Alexander Dancyg, Avraham Munder, Chaim Peri, Nadav Popplewell and Yagev Buchshtab. All but Munder had been announced dead in recent months by the Israeli military.
Israel’s Defense Minister Yoav Gallant said the IDF and ISA had entered Hamas tunnels in a “complex operation” to retrieve their bodies.
Munder was taken along with his wife, daughter and grandson, who were later freed during a temporary truce between Israel and Hamas in November. Munder’s son, Roee, was killed during the attack.
Nine-year-old Ohad Munder told Israel’s public broadcaster Kan 11 on Tuesday that the death of his grandfather and the other hostages “shouldn’t have happened.”
“There have already been many times when there were negotiations for (a) deal… and then they say no – and in the end they don’t want it, and always regret it at the last minute. All the hostages could have returned alive even on the first day. They could have brought back grandfather and all the other hostages,” Ohad said.
There are currently 109 Israeli hostages that remain in Gaza, including 36 believed to be dead, according to data from the Israeli Government Press Office.
CNN’s Kareem Khadder, Eyad Kourdi and Tamar Michaelis contributed reporting.
The-CNN-Wire
™ & © 2024 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. All rights reserved.

author: Anne Barrett Doyle
title: Confessions, Silence, and Child Abuse: Secrets of the Clergy | Fault Lines Documentary
text: () Aljazeera [Dohar, Qatar] December 20, 2023 [VIDEO] Over the past 20 years, religious organisations from the Catholic Church to Jehovah’s Witnesses have had a reckoning with cases of child sexual abuse. Many states have tried to tackle the abuse by making clergy mandatory reporters of abuse to officials, just like doctors, therapists and teachers are. However, more than 30 states in the United States do not require church officials to report knowledge or allegations of child abuse if the information is deemed privileged, specifically coming from confession or counselling. It means that abuse can all too often be hidden – and survivors are left without recourse or justice. Fault Lines investigates how state laws in the US can lead to child sexual abuse in religious communities going unpunished. Senior Producer: Kavitha Chekuru Correspondent: Natasha Del Toro Director of Photography: Erik Ljung Editor: Leslie Atkins Executive Producer: Laila Al-Arian Production Manager: Anabelle Rojas Fact-checking: Abdulai Bah Sound Mix: Linus Bergman
